qas.question: What is the world's largest low latitude hot desert?
What ares is the Sahara located in?
What makes it difficult for clouds to form?
What is the largest high-latitude desert?
What desert is located on the subtropical ridge?
What does the rising air do?
What is the largest high latitude desert?

plausible_answers.text: a warming and a drying effect

qas.question: What does the ascending airflow cause?
Where is the belt of permanent subtropical warm-core pressure located?

plausible_answers.text: sinking air prevents evaporating water from rising and, therefore, prevents the adiabatic cooling

qas.question: Why is cloud formation so common?

context: <b3_0><b4_0>The <a0_0><b7_0>Sahara<b7_0/><b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> is the world's largest low-latitude hot desert. The area is located in the <a1_0>horse latitudes<a1_0/> <b9_0>under the subtropical ridge<b9_0/>, a significant belt of semi-permanent subtropical warm-core high pressure where the air from upper levels of the troposphere tends to sink towards the ground. This steady descending airflow causes <b8_0>a warming and a drying effect<b8_0/> in the upper troposphere. The <a2_0><b10_0><b11_0>sinking air<b10_0/><a2_0/> <b5_0>prevents evaporating water from rising<b5_0/> and, therefore, prevents the <b6_0>adiabatic cooling<b11_0/><b6_0/>, which makes cloud formation extremely difficult to nearly impossible.
